content.webTitle: Horse racing: Murphy closes in on Pipe job

fields.headline: Murphy closes in on Pipe job
fields.bodyText: Timmy Murphy is an odds-on chance to replace Tony McCoy as Britain's new champion jump jockey after signing a retainer to ride as principal jockey to David Johnson, last year's leading owner and the major owner at Martin Pipe's powerful yard. However, Murphy is not - as yet - an official replacement for McCoy, now with Jonjo O'Neill, as Pipe's stable jockey. "I must stress that the arrangement between us does not take in other owners at Martin's yard," Johnson said yesterday. "But obviously he may ride for them in the future as well."
